meta.rules: Short nonacademic texts (15–150 words). 2–3 multiple-choice questions per passage. Skills: main purpose, inferences, informal language, skimming/scanning.

passages.title: Email from Building Management
passages.subject: Scheduled water maintenance – Tuesday 14 March
passages.content:
Dear residents,

Please be informed that our water supply will be temporarily shut off on Tuesday, 14 March, between 9:00 AM and 12:00 noon. This is necessary for repairs to the main pipeline in the basement.

We advise you to store some water in advance for drinking and basic use. The lift will continue to operate as usual. We apologise for any inconvenience and will complete the work as quickly as possible.

If you have any questions, please contact the management office.

Best regards,
Building Management

questions.text: What is the main purpose of this email?
options: To announce a new building management team
To inform residents about a temporary water shut-off for repairs
To remind residents to pay their water bills
To invite residents to a meeting about the building
questions.explanation: The email states that the water supply will be shut off for repairs to the main pipeline, so the main purpose is to inform residents about this scheduled maintenance.

questions.text: What should residents do before Tuesday?
options: Leave the building during the maintenance
Store some water for drinking and basic use
Pay an extra fee for the repairs
questions.explanation: The email advises residents to store some water in advance for drinking and basic use.

passages.title: Policy blog
passages.author: Research Institute
passages.content: Our latest briefing examines the implications of the new regulations for small and medium-sized enterprises. While the phased implementation allows time to adapt, many businesses have expressed concern about the administrative burden and the cost of compliance. We argue that early engagement with the guidance—rather than waiting until the final phase—is likely to reduce both. The full briefing is available on our website; we welcome feedback from practitioners.

passages.title: Policy statement
passages.content: The organisation is committed to ensuring that no applicant or participant receives less favourable treatment on grounds of race, gender, age, disability, religion, or sexual orientation. We recognise that equality of opportunity cannot be achieved by a policy statement alone; it requires the active promotion of inclusive practices and the removal of barriers that may persist in spite of legal compliance. All staff and contractors are expected to familiarise themselves with the full policy document and to report any concerns through the designated channels. This statement is subject to periodic review in line with evolving best practice and regulatory guidance.

questions.explanation: The text states that equality of opportunity requires the active promotion of inclusive practices and the removal of barriers that may persist in spite of legal compliance.

passages.title: Consultation response
passages.subject: Summary of consultation outcomes
passages.content: Thank you to all who contributed to the recent consultation on the proposed changes. The majority of respondents expressed support for the principle of the reforms, whilst raising substantive concerns regarding the proposed timeline and the adequacy of the transition arrangements. In light of the feedback, we are revising the implementation schedule and will publish a supplementary document addressing the transition by the end of the month. We do not consider it appropriate to proceed to the next phase until that document has been circulated and stakeholders have had a further opportunity to comment.

questions.text: What did most respondents support?

questions.explanation: The email says 'The majority of respondents expressed support for the principle of the reforms.'

questions.text: Why will the next phase not start yet?

A supplementary document will be published and stakeholders will have a further chance to comment
The Policy Unit has not finished revising
questions.explanation: They 'do not consider it appropriate to proceed... until that document has been circulated and stakeholders have had a further opportunity to comment.'

passages.title: Governance
passages.content: Decisions of the committee shall be binding on all members. Where a matter falls within the remit of more than one subcommittee, the chair shall determine which body shall take the lead; the other(s) shall be consulted and their views recorded in the minutes. No resolution may be passed in the absence of a quorum, which is defined as two-thirds of the appointed members. Members with a declared conflict of interest must recuse themselves from both the discussion and the vote. The committee shall report to the board on a quarterly basis.

questions.text: What must happen when a matter involves more than one subcommittee?

questions.explanation: The notice states that the chair shall determine which body takes the lead; the other(s) shall be consulted and their views recorded in the minutes.

questions.text: According to the notice, what is a quorum?
questions.explanation: The notice defines quorum as two-thirds of the appointed members.
